thread.title: House has no confidence in Vic minister - 9news.com.au
thread.title_full: House has no confidence in Vic minister - 9news.com.au

title: House has no confidence in Vic minister - 9news.com.au
text:
House has no confidence in Vic minister By AAP 
Victoria's beleaguered Youth Affairs Minister Jenny Mikakos has lost the confidence of fellow MPs in the upper house over her handling of the youth justice system. 
A motion of no confidence was successfully moved by the Liberals on Wednesday. 
Her Labor colleagues did not vote in favour of the motion. 
A series of violent riots in the Parkville and Malmsbury youth detention facilities, including a mass break out in January, has seen Ms Mikakos come under heavy scrutiny over her handling of the portfolio. 
"Your minister has been an absolute failure," Liberal spokeswoman for families and children Georgie Crozier said when she introduced the motion on February 8. 
"There have been more than 30 riots or serious incidents at youth justice facilities since October 2015." 
Despite the motion, Ms Mikakos said she would not be resigning. 
"This is a meaningless political exercise. I'm focused on fixing the youth justice system, something the Liberals failed to do for four long wasted years," she said in a statement. 
Rioting teens have caused more than $3.3 million damage to the state's youth justice centres from July 2015 to November 2016. 
A riot in Parkville last year made the centre uninhabitable and prompted the government to move detainees to the adult Barwon maximum security prison near Geelong. 
That move was then fought in the Supreme Court by human rights and Aboriginal Legal Service lawyers. 
Earlier this month, Ms Mikakos, Premier Daniel Andrews and Treasurer Tim Pallas announced a new $288 million youth jail for Werribee South. 
The announcement has been met with fierce opposition from nearby residents who question how the site west of Melbourne was selected. Â© AAP 2017
